question: Question_01_(a)
statement:
In this question we will work with polynomials of degree 3 written

\begin{align*}\displaystyle
p(x) = a_1x^3 + a_2x^2 + a_3x + a_4\end{align*}

\textbf{(a)} The coefficient vector $\mathbf{a} = [a_1,a_2,a_3,a_4]^T$
satisfies an equation of the form \emph{A\textbf{a}=\textbf{0}} when the
slopes of \emph{p(x)} at \emph{x = 0} and \emph{x = 2} are zero. Write
down the matrix \emph{A}.
hints: Recall that we can compute the slope at a point using the derivative.

Notice that once we sub \emph{x=0} and \emph{x=2} into the derivative we
will have linear equations in terms of the unknowns. How can we combine
those equations to form a matrix?
